questions.question_text:
A business is demanding faster IT services turnaround from its IT groups. The current lead time between request and delivery is three weeks for a task that would take a competitor two days. An architect is asked to develop a solution to reduce the lead time of the request while ensuring adherence to the company policies.
Which of the following is the BEST approach to achieve the stated objective?

choices.B: Revise the schedule, implement a waterfall methodology, and flatten the network.
choices.D: Follow the company policies, execute the flow, and document results.
choices.C: Identify deficiencies, optimize change management, and automate the workflow.
choices.A: Document the desired state, complete a root cause analysis, and execute the flow.

choices.D: Set hard limits for VM resources and turn on hyperthreading.
choices.C: Overcommit memory, and the systems will allocate resources as required.
choices.B: Ensure dynamic resource allocation is being utilized.
choices.A: Ensure hyperthreading is being utilized with physical server CPUs.

discussion.content: Why not C? I think should be overcommit memory

question is not asking to add more but to better utilize the resources within the cluster without affecting failover and redundancy. Overcommit memory will activity allocate more memory to any VM that needs it and bounce around depending on the load. the downside will be if all servers are being highly utilize then there might be some performance issues but no failover or redundancy issues.
